vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
πλάνος [ᾰ], ον,

__1 active, leading astray, deceiving, π. κατέσειον ἐδωδάν the bait, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]; π. δῶρα, ἄγρα, [NT+2nd c.BC+]
__2 passive, wandering, roaming, fickle, ποικίλον πρᾶγμ᾽ ἐστὶ καὶ πλάνον τύχη [Refs 4th c.BC+]; π. φέγγη planets, [Refs 4th c.AD+]
__II substantive πλάνος, ὁ, ={πλάνη}, wandering, roaming, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.b κερκίδος πλάνοι, of the act of weaving, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.2 metaphorically, φροντίδος πλάνοι wanderings of thought, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; π. φρενῶν wandering of mind, madness, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; πλάνοις in uncertain fits, of a disease, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ={πλάνη}[Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.3 digression, [Refs]
__II.4 error, [Refs 1st c.AD+]; grammatical mistake, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__III of persons, πλάνος, ὁ, vagabond,impostor, [NT+4th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: deceiving, leading astray; (n.) deceiver, imposter; figuratively extensions of the base meaning "to wander off a path," not found in the NT
